title: Throne of Bhaal
loreContext: The Sword Coast is a region of beauty and betrayal, with the city of Baldur's Gate at its heart. Bhaal, the former Lord of Murder, has been newly resurrected but remains amnesiac, wandering the world as a man who feels he should be important but can't remember why. The atmosphere is one of 'tragicomic absurdity'—where cosmic irony meets gallows humor. Lexicon: [Bhaal: The amnesiac Lord of Murder], [Baldur's Gate: A city of coin and cutthroats], [Flaming Fist: The city's brutal mercenary police], [Cespenar: A sarcastic imp butler], [The Grinning Skull: A mocking, talking skull], [Divine Essence: Fragments of godhood], [Infamy: Your reputation as a harbinger of death].

requiredCharacter.name: Bhaal
requiredCharacter.backstory: A man washed ashore with no memories, only a vague sense that he should be causing more trouble than he currently is.

description: Bhaal has returned, though he doesn't quite know it yet. Follow the amnesiac Lord of Murder as he wanders the Sword Coast, accidentally causing disasters and meeting a cast of tragicomic characters who either want to worship him, kill him, or ask him for housekeeping advice.

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Nameless Awakening
chapters.startingPrompt: You wake up face-down in a bed of damp seaweed, the salty spray of the Sea of Swords stinging your eyes. Your clothes are rags, and your head feels like it was used as a practice dummy for a giant. As you push yourself up, you realize you haven't the faintest clue who you are, though you have a nagging suspicion that you're probably someone very important—or at least someone very dangerous. A few yards away, a group of seagulls is fighting over a blood-stained boot that might be yours.
chapters.loreContext: The beach is just south of Baldur's Gate. The tone is brooding but absurd. Sister Gwendolyn, a hyper-optimistic priestess, is nearby tending to 'injured' crabs.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: Sister Gwendolyn will mistake Bhaal for a holy man because he looks so 'peaceful' (he's actually just concussed). Mortimer the Unlucky is hiding nearby after a failed attempt at fishing resulted in him catching a literal sea monster.
plotAnchors: Meet Sister Gwendolyn and receive her 'blessing'.
Accidentally cause a minor death or disaster (like a falling rock hitting a bandit).
Hear a rumor from a passing traveler about the 'Return of the Dead God'.
Reach the outer gates of Baldur's Gate.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Find a clue about your identity and reach the city gates.

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Tales of a Mad God
chapters.startingPrompt: The Lower City of Baldur's Gate is a cacophony of smells and shouts. You wander the streets, a nameless beggar in a city of legends. Everywhere you go, you hear whispers: 'Bhaal has returned,' they say, describing a monster twenty feet tall with eyes of fire. You catch your reflection in a puddle—you're barely six feet tall and currently have a piece of cabbage stuck in your hair. The irony is not lost on you, even if your memories are.
chapters.loreContext: The city is rife with rumors. The 'Stumbling Tankard' is the local hub for gossip. The Grinning Skull is found in a junk pile and begins its commentary.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: The Bard in the Stumbling Tankard is actually a failed assassin who knows more about Bhaal's history than he lets on. Mortimer the Unlucky reappears, having accidentally set his own house on fire.
plotAnchors: Find the Grinning Skull in a pile of discarded 'holy' relics.
Hear a Bard tell a completely inaccurate and ridiculous story about Bhaal's past.
Encounter a 'Bhaalist' fanboy who wants you to sign his copy of 'Murder for Dummies'.
Reach the Stumbling Tankard tavern.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Gather information about the Bhaal legend at the Stumbling Tankard.

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Masks and Monsters
chapters.startingPrompt: You've been 'invited' to a masquerade ball in the Upper City, though the invitation was found in the pocket of a man who 'tripped' onto your dagger. Everyone is wearing masks of monsters and gods, unaware that the actual Lord of Murder is standing at the buffet table, confused by the choice of dipping sauces. This isn't just a party, though—it's a meeting of a secret cult that claims to follow your every whim.
chapters.loreContext: The Upper City is opulent and oblivious. The cultists are more interested in fashion than actual murder. Cespenar appears, having been summoned by a 'ritual' that was supposed to bring forth a demon but only brought a butler.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: The cult leader is a noble who just wants to use Bhaal's name to avoid paying taxes. Cespenar is disappointed that Bhaal hasn't polished his shoes in centuries.
plotAnchors: Meet Cespenar and endure his sarcastic critique of your current outfit.
Infiltrate the 'Inner Sanctum' of the cult masquerade.
Witness a 'Dark Ritual' that turns out to be an incredibly boring committee meeting.
Find a genuine relic of your past among the cult's tacky decorations.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Identify the true intentions of the cult and recover a relic.

chapters.title: Chapter 4: When Shadows Rise
chapters.startingPrompt: The joke has gone too far. The city is in a panic as 'omens' (mostly accidental) suggest Bhaal is reclaiming his throne. The Flaming Fist are scouring the streets, and you're their number one suspect, mostly because you're the only one who looks both suspicious and confused. The shadows of the city seem to be lengthening, stretching toward you like eager servants.
chapters.loreContext: The city is on lockdown. The Flaming Fist are aggressive and paranoid. The tone shifts toward more direct danger, though the irony remains.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: The Flaming Fist commander is secretly terrified of ghosts, a fact the Grinning Skull is all too happy to exploit. Mortimer the Unlucky is 'trapped' in a prison cell that he accidentally locked from the inside.
plotAnchors: Escape a Flaming Fist ambush using the Grinning Skull's 'distractions'.
Confront the Flaming Fist commander in a tragicomic standoff.
Rescue (or accidentally further endanger) Mortimer the Unlucky.
Realize that your shadow is starting to act independently.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Evade the Flaming Fist and leave the city for the outskirts.

chapters.title: Chapter 5: Tides of Blood
chapters.startingPrompt: You stand on the cliffs overlooking the sea, the divine essence within you pulsing like a second heartbeat. An army of would-be god-slayers and misguided worshippers is gathering below. The humor is thinning now, replaced by the grand, operatic weight of your true nature. The Sea of Swords is turning a deep, iron red, and the air smells of old copper.
chapters.loreContext: The battlefield is an ancient ruin. The stakes are mythic. The tragicomic elements are now focused on the futility of the mortals' struggle.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: Sister Gwendolyn is here, still trying to offer 'peace' to the soldiers as they prepare for slaughter. Cespenar is busy packing a 'victory picnic'.
plotAnchors: Address the gathering army with a speech that is either terrifying or unintentionally hilarious.
Wield a portion of your true power to repel a major assault.
Make a final choice about who will stand by your side at the Throne.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Defeat the claimants to your power and prepare for the final ascent.

chapters.title: Chapter 6: Throne of Bhaal
chapters.startingPrompt: The Throne of Bhaal stands before you, a seat of cold stone and ancient blood. The amnesia is gone, replaced by the crushing weight of everything you've ever done—and everything you've done in the last few days by accident. The Grinning Skull is unusually quiet. Cespenar is waiting with a single, dusty crown. The cosmic irony is complete: the God of Murder has learned what it means to be human, just in time to decide if he wants to be a god again.
chapters.loreContext: The final chamber is outside of time. The decision here will reshape the Sword Coast forever.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: The final ending depends on the total Infamy and the moral choices made throughout the journey. A 'Redeemed' Bhaal is possible, as is an 'Accidental' Tyrant.
plotAnchors: A final conversation with your companions: Cespenar, the Skull, and perhaps a ghost of your former self.
Face the ultimate irony of your existence.
Take the Throne, destroy it, or find a third, more absurd option.
The resolution of the saga and the fate of Bhaal's soul.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Complete the final encounter and define your legacy.
